entry.title: Calculating entropy
entry.summary: This article looks into how to calculate entropy. The article includes example C code.

entry.title: Can Rust help?
entry.summary: In this article I look into some problems with C pointers and wonder if Rust can help.

entry.title: Ever expanding memory
entry.summary: A brief look at how console memory has oncreased over the years.

entry.title: Cracking the Fog Creek coding problem
entry.summary: In this article I take a look at how to crack the Fog Creek content developer coding puzzle.

entry.title: Dealing with dates
entry.summary: In this article I describe dates, how they are used on this site, and how you can generate ISO-8601 format dates on the Mac OS X command line.

entry.title: Caching in
entry.summary: A look back at how disk caching software and disk de-fragmenters were A Thing back in the 90s.

entry.title: Diving into the buffer pool
entry.summary: In this article I provide some brief notes on buffer pools.

entry.title: Don't forget the Unix tools
entry.summary: There are times when the best approach is not to reinvent the wheel but use the numerous command line tools available in Unix.

entry.title: Excel ain't a database!
entry.summary: A light-hearted story on the problems of using Excel as a database.

entry.title: Don't forget to flush!
entry.summary: On solving a mysterious problem in a CGI web app.

entry.title: How Python saved my sanity!
entry.summary: A light hearted look into how Python can help you retain your sanity!

entry.title: Python env issue on Ubuntu 16.04
entry.summary: Describes an issue where Python couldn't be found on Ubuntu.

entry.title: Remembering TurboDOS
entry.summary: Back in the early 80s the company I worked for ran its entire operation on a Z-80 based operating system called TurboDOS. This article fondly remembers how capable the system was.

entry.title: Spreadsheets everywhere
entry.summary: On the phenomenon of the spreadsheet that starts out innocently enough and then becomes an out-of-control beast.

entry.title: Stdout was a bad, bad boy
entry.summary: Sometimes an application may open `stdout` with ASCII encoding, rather than UTF-8.

entry.title: Tales from the Bcrypt
entry.summary: Bcrypt proves to be a very convenient library for encrypting passwords.

entry.summary: I managed to create some useful macros for debugging C programs.

entry.summary: On various attempts to try and trace memory allocations.

entry.title: How long to transfer a 1TB file?
entry.summary: How long does it take to transfer a 1TB file? Python can help.

entry.title: Why I still use Emacs
entry.summary: A light-hearted story on why I still use Emacs.

entry.summary: In this article I look at what I think are some serious issues with the web today.

entry.summary: An overview of the Wolfenstein 3D compacting memory allocator.
